snippet: The International Criminal Court said that the government was legally required to arrest Omar al-Bashir of Sudan, who faces charges of war crimes.
abstract: South African authorities allow Sudanese Pres Omar Hassan al-Bashir to fly home after African Union meeting despite longstanding arrest warrant in International Criminal Court for war crimes, crimes against humanity and genocide; plane departs before South Africa's High Court rules that government is legally required to arrest him.

byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from London; Isma’il Kushkush from Nairobi, Kenya; and Marlise Simons from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The International Criminal Court said that the government was legally required to arrest Omar al-Bashir of Sudan, who faces charges of war crimes.

headline.main: Omar al-Bashir, Leaving South Africa, Eludes Arrest Again
headline.print_headline: Leaving South Africa, Sudan’s Leader Eludes Arrest Again

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
